definition: (of enemies) cannot live under the same sky/absolutely irreconcilable
common/general/to share/together/total/altogether/abbr. for 共產黨|共产党[Gong4 chan3 dang3], Communist party
to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc)/to respect/to bear/to support

sentences.english: The lack of proprieties would make the most intimate friends turn to be the most decided enemies.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏禮節會使最親密的朋友變成不共戴天的仇敵。
他們是我們不共戴天的仇敵。

sentences.english: Under Mourinho's stewardship, Chelsea once became a sworn enemy of European governing body UEFA.
sentences.chinese: 切爾西在穆里尼奧執教期間曾與歐足聯不共戴天。

sentences.english: I want him to identify him enemy Tong Pak Fu.
sentences.chinese: 讓他當面認一下，他不共戴天的仇人唐伯虎。

sentences.english: Jack and Peter have been at daggers drawn for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 傑克和彼得長期以來不共戴天。

sentences.english: You and I are at daggers drawn.
sentences.chinese: 我們的仇恨不共戴天，我與你勢不兩立。
他是傑克不共戴天的敵人。

sentences.english: The enemy has been shelling us all day.
sentences.chinese: 他倆是不共戴天的仇敵。

sentences.english: Adams and I were deadly enemies.
sentences.chinese: 亞當斯和我是不共戴天的死敵。

sentences.english: Hurons, this is your mortal enemy.
sentences.chinese: 休倫人，他就是你們不共戴天的仇人。

sentences.english: The antagonisms between the two empires and systems were mortal.
sentences.chinese: 這兩個帝國和兩種制度之間，有着不共戴天的仇恨。

definition: the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
to fight to one's last gasp
an old grudge/old scores to settle
to hate sb to the bone (idiom)
hatred/animosity/enmity/foe/enemy/to feel animosity toward (the wealthy, foreigners etc)
to take revenge and wipe out a grudge (idiom)
